results.question: Why do AI image generators pose risks to human artists?
incorrect_answers: As artwork off the internet can be used in their training sets, stealing the artists work/style.
People think artwork produced by robots is cooler.
AI can produce artwork cheaper and more efficiently than people.

results.question: How do AI image generators produce images?
results.correct_answer: They have a database of artwork which they learn from, so they can respond to user prompts.
incorrect_answers: With little robot hands and an easel.
By asking human artists to draw them and then digitising these drawings into digital images.
By selecting pre-made templates and filling them with random colours and shapes.

results.question: What are the overall benefits of AI image generators?
results.correct_answer: They are efficient and cost effective.
incorrect_answers: They can predict the future by creating images of events that haven't happened yet.
They generally don’t require human input, so are fully automated.
They only create positive images, so help battle depression.

results.question: Which of these is NOT a way to identify AI-generated images?
results.correct_answer: Simply look for a tiny AI robot emoji hidden somewhere in the image.
incorrect_answers: Take a closer look at the people as there may be inconsistencies e.g. 6 fingers.
Inconsistent light sources, shadows aren’t where they should be.
Some features are fuzzy, and lack sharpness, leading to a dreamy feeling.

results.question: Who owns an image that an AI art generator creates?
results.correct_answer: It is unclear, as this is a complex legal issue.
incorrect_answers: The user who inputted the prompt.
The creator of the art generator.
The artist(s) whose work is in the generator’s training set.

results.question: How do you avoid plagiarism issues when using someone’s work?
incorrect_answers: Check how to credit them and do so accordingly.
Only use ideas/ snippets of others' work rather than the whole thing.
Consult the creator if it isn’t clear how to credit them.
